info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 5:48AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A HEAVY LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN ERIE AND NORTHERN ERIE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy lake effect snow continues to move slowly north across the Buffalo Metro, now reaching as far north as South Buffalo, West Seneca and Cheektowaga. This lake effect snow band is will produce extremely heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour and visibility locally reduced to less than one-half mile as it continues to lift north through the Buffalo Metro. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Lackawanna, Depew, Amherst, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Evans, Elma, Eden, Marilla, Orchard Park, Akron, Erie Basin Marina, Small Boat Harbor, and Alden. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 57A and Route 5 and Route 219. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
